definition: A brief and passing occurrence of precipitation from the atmosphere, typically characterized by a sudden and temporary increase in rainfall intensity. It is commonly used to describe a specific type of weather phenomenon that involves a short-lived burst of rain.

examples.english: There will be a rain shower today.

examples.german: Der Regenschauer dauerte nur wenige Minuten.
examples.english: The rain shower lasted only a few minutes.

examples.german: Wir wurden von einem plötzlichen Regenschauer überrascht.
examples.english: We were surprised by a sudden rain shower.

examples.german: Ein Regenschauer kann die Straßen rutschig machen.
examples.english: A rain shower can make the roads slippery.

examples.german: Der Regenschauer hat den Garten gut bewässert.
examples.english: The rain shower has watered the garden well.
